intro: Cicerbita auriculiformis, commonly known as the auriculate cicerbita, is a species of flowering plant in the family Campanulaceae. It is native to the Mediterranean region and is characterized by its distinctive auriculate (ear-shaped) leaves. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Cicerbita auriculiformis is often found in rocky or limestone habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal.
